name: 3-chloro-4-cyanopyridine
Reason: The basic unit pyridine has a melting point around -42 degree Celsius. Adding a chlorine substituent generally increases the melting point due to its relatively large size and its ability to participate in dipole-dipole interactions (+50). The nitrile group also increases the melting point due to its high electronegativity and the potential for intermolecular dipole-dipole interactions (+65). These influences are additive because they do not interfere with each other's electronic effects on the molecule.
Prediction: Pyridine base: -42, Chlorine substituent: +50, Nitrile group: +65 --> Prediction: -42 + 50 + 65 = 73°C
